intro: Scrophularia pamiroalaica, commonly known as the Pamir Scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes a variety of herbaceous plants and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its upright stems, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
